title: 17 Spiritual Meanings of Hiccups (And How to Interpret Them)

steps.title: You need to reflect on your goals and purpose.
steps.content: You need to reflect on your goals and purpose. Zuk says, “Hiccups can have different spiritual meanings,” one of which is “inviting [you] to reflect and gain awareness of key issues in [your] life.” The universe might be telling you to think about what is and isn’t working in your life, how your goals are progressing, and what you can do to get closer to your dreams. What to do : Reflect on what’s important to you and what you’re prioritizing in your life. Then, make changes and set goals to help you move forward on your life journey.

steps.title: Your guardian angels are contacting you.
steps.content: Your guardian angels are contacting you. According to spiritual beliefs, random bouts of hiccups can signal that your guardian angels , spirit guides, or ancestors have something to tell you. Hiccups may be a way for your angels to get your attention and give you guidance or advice, remind you that they’re near to protect you, or reassure you that you’re on the right path. [1] X Research source What to do : Pay attention to what’s going on around you and listen to what your spirit guides are telling you. Then, thank them for their message.

steps.title: You’re on someone’s mind.
steps.content: You’re on someone’s mind. It’s a popular folklore belief that a sudden onset of hiccups signifies someone is thinking of you —whether they’re having good or bad thoughts. This can be a sign that your crush is daydreaming about you, a family member is worried about you, or an ex-friend is bad-mouthing you. [2] X Research source According to folklore, you can find the culprit by going through a list of people you know in your head. When you get to the person who is thinking about you, your hiccups will stop.

steps.title: You need to be more present.
steps.content: You need to be more present. Zuk says hiccups “may also serve as a reminder to be present and mindful”—they can signify that you’re caught up in the past or worrying about the future. He claims that your hiccups might be “encouraging you to pause and reflect on your current thoughts and feelings” so you can enjoy where you are right now . What to do : Practice mindfulness to help reduce stress and stay present. Pay attention to your senses and breathe deeply . Then, set an intention to be accepting of what’s happening right now. [3] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: It’s time to express your feelings.
steps.content: It’s time to express your feelings . According to Zuk, “hiccups may signify the release of pent-up emotions” and “symbolize the need to express feelings that have been suppressed or ignored.” The universe might be encouraging you to speak up and tell people how you feel, which can help you deal with what’s bothering you. What to do : Find a calm, quiet moment to speak to the person about what’s bothering you. Take a deep breath and use “I” language to communicate how you feel. Listen to their feelings and then work together to find a solution. [4] X Research source If you’re not ready to talk, express your feelings creatively. For instance, journal, paint, or play music.

steps.title: Your guardian angels are sending a warning.
steps.content: Your guardian angels are sending a warning. Some people believe that random bouts of hiccups are a sign to be prepared for challenges ahead. Your guardian angels or spirit guides might be telling you to follow your intuition and proceed with caution when meeting someone new or making a big decision. [5] X Research source What to do : Pay attention to how you feel about what’s happening around you. If a person is making you uncomfortable or a decision is making you uneasy, it might be your intuition telling you to stay away.

steps.title: You need to nurture your spiritual connection.
steps.content: You need to nurture your spiritual connection . If you randomly get the hiccups, your spirit guides might be telling you that you’ve been neglecting your spiritual needs. Stress and other priorities may have put your spirituality on the back burner, so now is the time to focus on your practice and get in touch with your higher self. [6] X Research source What to do : Get back into your spiritual practice. For instance, this can be your sign to meditate , practice yoga , or attend religious services again.

steps.title: Someone is missing you.
steps.content: Someone is missing you. According to spiritual beliefs, getting the hiccups out of nowhere is a sign from the universe that someone wishes you were near . This might be a crush who’s longing for your affection, a friend who wants to reconnect, or a passed loved one who’s letting you know they’re close by. [7] X Research source To find out who’s thinking about you, go through a list of people in your mind. According to folk belief, your hiccups will stop when you think of the person who misses you. What to do : Take your hiccups as a sign to reach out to your loved ones. Send a quick text or make a phone call to catch up and remind them that you love them, too.

steps.title: Your soulmate is around or thinking about you.
steps.content: Your soulmate is around or thinking about you. Many people believe that getting the hiccups without a clear cause is a sign your soulmate is thinking of you . This can signify that they’re nearby and that you’ll meet them soon. [8] X Research source What to do : To help find your soulmate , meet new people by joining a club, volunteering, or signing up for a dating app. You’ll know that you’ve met your soulmate if you instantly connect and feel like you’ve known them forever. Some people believe that if you get hiccups at the same time as your partner or crush, this means that you’re soulmates.

steps.title: You’re about to experience big, positive changes.
steps.content: You’re about to experience big, positive changes. Suddenly getting the hiccups can signal major changes in your personal and professional life. This might be a sign that you’ll find love, make a move to a new city, or start your dream job. [9] X Research source What to do : Take this as a sign to be open and accepting of change . While change can be hard, try to look at it as an exciting opportunity and remind yourself that it helps you grow.

steps.title: You’re experiencing a spiritual awakening.
steps.content: You’re experiencing a spiritual awakening. When you randomly get the hiccups, especially at night, you might be undergoing a spiritual awakening . This can mean that major realizations are on the horizon—you might gain clarity about your life’s purpose, develop your intuition , heal your spirit, and become your best self. [10] X Research source Other signs that you might be having a spiritual awakening include seeking change, feeling separated from your old self, connecting with nature, and seeing angel numbers .

steps.title: It’s time to release negativity.
steps.content: It’s time to release negativity. Spiritually, hiccups may be a way for you to get rid of negative energy in your life and feel at peace. Think of your hiccups as worries, past hurts, and negative emotions bubbling in you. Acknowledge your feelings and then release them into the air. [11] X Research source What to do : Take steps to cultivate a more positive mindset when you get the hiccups, too. For instance, recite positive affirmations and practice gratitude each day. [12] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: You need to listen to your intuition.
steps.content: You need to listen to your intuition. If you get the hiccups out of nowhere, your intuition may be trying to tell you something. This might be a spiritual signal to pause, take in what’s happening around you, and listen to your gut instincts. [13] X Research source For instance, if you’re talking to someone, your hiccups may be a sign to stop speaking—the person might not have your best interests at heart.

steps.title: You’re feeling confident and powerful.
steps.content: You’re feeling confident and powerful. Hiccups can help you unblock the solar plexus chakra . The solar plexus chakra is related to willpower and strength and is located at the base of the sternum and below your rib cage; this is also where your diaphragm is, which causes hiccups. [14] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Your hiccups might help unblock your solar plexus chakra if it’s out of balance and fill you with confidence, energy, and purpose. [15] X Research source Other ways to unblock the solar plexus chakra are to take deep breaths, meditate, and wear yellow.

steps.title: You need to restore balance in your life.
steps.content: You need to restore balance in your life. When you randomly get the hiccups, the universe might be letting you know that you’re mentally, physically, and spiritually out of balance. This can be a sign to focus on yourself and prioritize what matters to feel whole again, whether that’s tending to your relationships or getting ahead in your career. [16] X Research source What to do : Practice self-care to feel more in balance. For instance, pursue your hobbies, exercise, hang out with friends, or meditate.

steps.title: Negative energy is around you.
steps.content: Negative energy is around you. While hiccups are usually a positive spiritual symbol, some people believe they mean negative energy or evil spirits are surrounding you. In some cultures, this might be a sign that someone gave you the evil eye or that bad luck is following you around. [17] X Research source What to do : Perform spiritual rituals to cleanse any negative energy you feel around you. For instance, you might burn sage , use crystals for protection , or wear protective symbols like the evil eye or hamsa hand.

steps.title: You’re dealing with karma.
steps.content: You’re dealing with karma. In some spiritual circles, randomly getting the hiccups is related to karma, which is the belief that good and bad actions have good and bad consequences. [18] X Research source So, your hiccups may be a sign that you’re reaping the rewards of good karma or dealing with the fallout of bad karma. What to do : If you’re dealing with bad karma, acknowledge what you did and apologize to anyone you hurt to help reverse it . Then, be kind and help others to help balance out your karma.

steps.title: Hiccups can be either a good or bad omen.
steps.content: Hiccups can be either a good or bad omen. According to spiritual beliefs, hiccups are messages from the spiritual realm that are meant to either guide you or warn you about something. Some people believe that they signify exciting transformations while others see them as a sign of challenges ahead. To decode the meaning of your hiccups, pay attention to how you feel when you have them. Do you feel inspired and protected or on alert? Also, consider what’s going on in your life to help determine what your spirit guides are trying to tell you.

steps.title: Hiccups are caused by spasms of the diaphragm.
steps.content: Hiccups are caused by spasms of the diaphragm. The diaphragm muscle sits under your lungs and separates your chest from your abdomen. Drinking, swallowing air, or even emotional stress can cause this muscle to spasm. The spasms cause your vocal cords to shut, which makes a “hic” sound. You typically get hiccups by drinking carbonated beverages or alcohol, eating a big meal, swallowing air, feeling excited, or experiencing a lot of stress. [19] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Hiccups usually only last a few minutes and go away on their own. While there’s no medically proven cure to get rid of hiccups, home remedies like holding your breath and drinking cold water can help them go away .
